result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:02 PM Defendant Kyle J Atherton in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Kyle J Atherton.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense moves to withdraw from the Defendant's cases, due to conflict on case re: victim on 22CM718. Defense was unaware of conflict as original victim key on that case misspelled the victims name. 

Court will allow Atty Menden to withdraw as counsel, and set for a hearing on status of counsel. Jury trial on 10/25/2022 is off. Motion to Join Cases held in abeyance pending appointment of new counsel.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:06 PM . Defendant Kyle J Atherton in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Kyle J Atherton.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for Motion Hearing on Motion to Join Cases filed by the State. 

Defense requests to adjourn jury trial set on 22CM718 due to discovery issues, but is ready to proceed with Motion. 
State does not object to adjourning Motion and Jury Trial. 

Defense states that Defendant now wants to leave jury trial on as set. Court gives Defense some time to speak in the hallway with the Defendant. 

Case re-called at 4:22 PM. 

Defense states that further investigation is needed, but that the Defendant wants to leave the jury trial on as set. 

Court will set Motion Hearing for Motion to Join for 10/20/2022 at 2:00 pm and move the jury status to the same date/time.

Hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.Defendant to have no contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Amended Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
